data.tooltip: Health anxiety feeds into stress and hypervigilance cycle

data.label: OR 2.07
data.tooltip: Psychological stress activates the HPA axis, elevating cortisol (Chemelo 2020, OR 2.07)
Stress drives catecholamine release via sympathoadrenal pathway
Elevated cortisol shifts autonomic balance toward sympathetic dominance
Catecholamines amplify sympathetic nervous system activity
Sympathetic shift lowers microarousal threshold during sleep
Obstructive sleep apnea causes repeated upper airway collapse

data.label: 85.7% linked
data.tooltip: Airway obstruction triggers cortical microarousals (85.7% linked, Saito 2014)
Airway obstruction creates negative intrathoracic pressure
Negative pressure triggers transient LES relaxation (Kuribayashi 2010)
TLESR allows gastric acid to reflux into esophagus

data.label: 62-78% comorbid
data.tooltip: OSA and GERD are highly comorbid (62-78% overlap)
GERD produces chronic acid reflux and micro-aspiration
GERD causes pepsin reflux into esophagus and larynx

data.label: vagal afferents
data.tooltip: Esophageal acid contact activates vagal afferent neurons
Vagal afferent firing triggers brainstem-mediated microarousals

data.label: visceral hypersens.
data.tooltip: Stress increases visceral hypersensitivity to acid exposure

data.label: hyperarousal
data.tooltip: Stress-induced hyperarousal is the primary driver of insomnia and sleep fragmentation
Genetic predisposition affects arousal threshold (21-50% heritable)
Sleep deprivation increases microarousal frequency
Sleep deprivation elevates cortisol via HPA axis activation

data.label: ~24% risk
data.tooltip: SSRIs suppress dopaminergic inhibition of motor patterns (~24% bruxism risk)
Caffeine antagonizes adenosine receptors, increasing arousal (1.5x odds)
Caffeine stimulates gastric acid secretion and may relax the lower esophageal sphincter
Alcohol causes rebound sympathetic activation during metabolism (2x odds)
Alcohol directly relaxes the LES and stimulates gastric acid production
Smoking increases sympathetic activation and arousal frequency (>2x odds)
Nicotine reduces lower esophageal sphincter pressure and impairs mucosal defense
GABA deficit reduces inhibitory control of motor pattern generators
Dopaminergic dysregulation affects basal ganglia motor circuits (preliminary)

data.label: GABA cofactor
data.tooltip: Magnesium is a GABA receptor cofactor; depletion impairs inhibitory tone
Vitamin D deficiency linked to neuromuscular dysfunction (OR 6.66, preliminary)

data.label: 79% precede
data.tooltip: 79% of RMMA episodes preceded by EEG microarousal (Kato 2001)
RMMA manifests clinically as nocturnal grinding and clenching

data.label: OR 2.25
data.tooltip: Repetitive RMMA forces cause TMJ damage (OR 2.25, Mortazavi 2023)

data.label: periodontal reflex
data.tooltip: RMMA triggers salivation via periodontal mechanoreceptor reflex
Chronic RMMA may contribute to central sensitization (preliminary)

data.label: acid clearance
data.tooltip: Increased salivation aids esophageal acid clearance (protective mechanism)

data.label: repeated swallowing
data.tooltip: Nocturnal salivary clearance may cause repeated swallowing, fatiguing neck/throat muscles (hypothesised)
Grinding forces cause progressive tooth enamel wear and fractures
Nocturnal muscle contraction causes morning tension headaches
Sustained clenching may lock up jaw/neck musculature, contributing to daytime spasm (hypothesised)
TMD dysfunction propagates to cervical spine via biomechanical chain

data.label: V3 spillover
data.tooltip: TMJ proximity causes referred ear symptoms via V3 nerve spillover
TMD alters suprahyoid muscle function and hyoid position
Chronic TMD pain drives trigeminocervical sensitization
TMD causes tension-type headaches via temporalis/masseteric muscle strain and TMJ dysfunction

data.label: EMG F=13.7
data.tooltip: Forward head posture increases masseter EMG and TMJ loading (F=13.7)
FHP displaces hyoid bone anteroinferiorly

data.label: TCC convergence
data.tooltip: Cervical afferents converge at trigeminocervical complex (TCC)

data.label: cervicogenic
data.tooltip: Cervical dysfunction causes cervicogenic headaches via C1-C3 afferent convergence on trigeminal nucleus caudalis (IHS recognised)
Cervical dysfunction may promote compensatory forward head posture
Hyoid displacement contributes to globus sensation (preliminary)
Central sensitization enables temporal summation (wind-up)
Central sensitization amplifies headache pain (OPPERA: 28/36 pain measures elevated, Greenspan 2011)

data.label: SMD -1.10
data.tooltip: Central sensitization amplifies pain perception (SMD -1.10)
Sensitization amplifies pharyngeal sensation (globus)
Wind-up phenomenon causes progressive pain amplification
GERD/LPR may contribute to globus sensation (preliminary)
Pepsin in saliva damages pharyngeal tissue (preliminary)

data.label: hypervigilance
data.tooltip: Chronic pain drives stress and hypervigilance (vicious cycle)

data.label: disrupts sleep
data.tooltip: Pain disrupts sleep continuity, worsening bruxism triggers (vicious cycle)
TMD pain and dysfunction increase stress and anxiety (vicious cycle)
Morning headaches contribute to stress and worry (vicious cycle)
Morning headaches disrupt sleep quality and continuity (vicious cycle)

data.label: health anxiety
data.tooltip: Ear fullness and tinnitus drive health anxiety and stress (vicious cycle)

data.label: health anxiety
data.tooltip: Globus sensation triggers health anxiety (vicious cycle)
Sleep deprivation worsens airway collapsibility (vicious cycle)
PPI reduces gastric acid, treating GERD/reflux upstream

data.label: depletes Mg
data.tooltip: PPI side effect: chronic use depletes magnesium (OR 1.66)
Hard occlusal splint protects teeth from grinding damage
Magnesium supplementation restores GABA cofactor levels

data.label: GABA +27%
data.tooltip: Yoga increases brain GABA by 27% (Streeter 2007, P=.018)
Yoga reduces cortisol levels (Streeter 2007/2010)
Hydration dilutes esophageal acid contact
Hydration supports salivary flow for acid clearance
Vitamin D supplementation corrects deficiency
Multivitamin replenishes PPI-depleted magnesium and cofactors
Delayed breakfast reduces morning reflux episode severity
Morning light anchors circadian rhythm, improving sleep quality
Circadian stability reduces microarousal frequency
Mindfulness practice reduces perceived stress and hypervigilance
Regular meditation reduces cortisol levels
Physical therapy improves TMJ mobility and reduces pain
Rocabado exercises correct forward head posture
Cervical exercises address cervical dysfunction
Regular exercise improves sleep quality and duration
Exercise reduces chronic cortisol elevation
Nature exposure reduces stress via parasympathetic activation

Dietary modifications eliminate reflux triggers
Trigger avoidance reduces acid production and reflux episodes
Meal timing and upright posture reduce reflux episode frequency
Posture awareness corrects forward head positioning
Improved posture reduces cervical strain
Correct tongue posture improves hyoid positioning
Tongue posture improves airway patency
Jaw relaxation techniques reduce muscle tension and RMMA drive
Massage improves TMJ mobility (RCT, Frontiers 2022)
Massage reduces orofacial pain intensity
Heat therapy provides local vasodilation and pain relief
Heat/cold modulates pain via gate control mechanism
Bed elevation uses gravity to reduce nocturnal reflux
Elevation reduces acid contact time in supine position
Screen avoidance reduces pre-sleep arousal and improves sleep onset
Warm bathing shifts autonomic balance toward parasympathetic
taVNS stimulates vagal afferents to shift parasympathetic balance
Vagal stimulation reduces sympathetic tone
Extended exhale breathing activates vagal brake
Slow breathing reduces cortisol via HPA axis modulation
L-theanine enhances GABAergic inhibitory neurotransmission
Glycine acts as inhibitory neurotransmitter supporting GABA pathways
EMG biofeedback interrupts RMMA episodes (SMD -0.56, meta-analysis)
CPAP/MAD treats obstructive sleep apnea, eliminating apnea-driven arousals
Medication review + buspirone addresses SSRI-induced bruxism
Botox weakens masseter, reducing RMMA force (events 51.7/h)
Botox reduces orofacial pain (VAS -4.0, meta-analysis)
CBT addresses stress/anxiety contributors to bruxism

Good sleep hygiene reduces microarousal triggers

tooltip.mechanism: Exogenous triggers can affect sleep fragmentation, reflux, and microarousal pathways
HPA axis activation drives cortisol and sympathetic shift
Health anxiety amplifies stress response and hypervigilance
Airway obstruction triggers microarousals and negative pressure reflux
Acid micro-aspiration triggers vagal afferents and protective RMMA
Fragmented sleep architecture increases microarousal frequency
Polygenic predisposition to arousal threshold and motor pattern generation
Serotonergic suppression of dopaminergic inhibition of motor patterns
Adenosine receptor antagonism increases arousal frequency
Rebound sympathetic activation during alcohol metabolism
Nicotine increases sympathetic activation and arousal frequency

Catecholamine surge amplifies sympathetic tone and motor excitability
Autonomic shift precedes and triggers microarousals

Esophageal acid contact activates vagal afferents triggering protective RMMA
Vagal afferent firing from acid contact triggers brainstem arousal
Pepsin reactivation in saliva causes tissue damage at low pH
Reduced GABAergic inhibition lowers threshold for RMMA generation
Dopaminergic modulation of basal ganglia motor circuits affects RMMA
Magnesium is a GABA receptor cofactor; depletion impairs inhibitory tone
Vitamin D deficiency affects neuromuscular function and sleep quality
